key_points: Tiger Woods is back home in Florida after a car crash in California and undergoing emergency surgery.
The surgery was for "significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity."
Woods spent almost three weeks in the hospital and is focused on his recovery.
He is in good spirits, despite some pain, and focused on rehabilitation.
Woods expressed happiness at being reunited with his children, Charlie Axel and Sam Alexis.
He thanked the medical teams at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center and Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
The crash occurred on the morning of Feb. 23, when Woods' car sheared through a tree and landed in the brush with major damage.
Investigators have not found evidence that Woods attempted to prevent the crash.
A witness noticed Woods was unconscious immediately following the crash.
Woods had no recollection of driving or how the accident happened.
